summary: This bill, the "Maintaining Authority and Restoring Security to Halt the Abuse of Law" or "MARSHALS Act," aims to transfer the United States Marshals Service from the Department of Justice to the judicial branch. It outlines changes to the structure and oversight of the Marshals Service, establishing a Director appointed by the Chief Justice and supervised by a board. The bill also amends existing law regarding the Marshals Service's duties and responsibilities, including its ability to assist other law enforcement agencies and provide personal protection. Additionally, it makes technical and conforming amendments to various sections of the United States Code and the Homeland Security Act.
